storyDescription: A story about farmer's bill from Vishleshakee

elements.text: Farm Bills 2020 – An Analysis using विश्लेषकी (Vishleshakee)
OSINT Lab, Dept. of CSE, IIT Guwahati
https://www.iitg.ac.in/cseweb/osint/vishleshakee-v2/home
Introduction

The Indian agriculture acts of 2020, also known as the Farm Bills 2020, are three acts initiated by the Parliament of India in September 2020. The three acts are (i) The Farmers' Produce Trade and Commerce (Promotion and Facilitation) Act, 2020, (ii) Farmers (Empowerment and Protection) Agreement on Price Assurance and Farm Services Act, 2020, (iii) Essential Commodities (Amendment) Act, 2020. The Lok Sabha approved the bills on 17 September 2020 and the Rajya Sabha on 20 September 2020. Honourable president of India, Shree Ram Nath Kovind gave his assent on 27 September 2020. Concerning the uncertainly surrounding the minimum support prices (MSP), the farmers mainly from the states of Panjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh have protested the bills to be repealed. This article aims at analysing the tweets circulated on Twitter using विश्लेषकी (Vishleshakee). विश्लेषकी is a general purpose social media analytics tool developed at OSINT Lab in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Guwahati.

विश्लेषकी collects about three million tweets every day from various target handles and topics. This analysis focuses on the tweets received by विश्लेषकी during the period of 1st September 2020 till 18th February 2021, and related to the Farm Bills 2020 and the protest against the bills. The dataset has been extracted using the 90 manually identified hashtags related to farm bills 2020. It consists of 36,56,487 tweets posted from 1,70,709 users, and contains 40,223 hashtags and 36971 mentions. Figure 1 shows the distributed of the 3.6 million tweets related to farm bills over time, and the fist tweet is spotted on 10th September 2020.
Fig. 1: Evolution of tweets related to Farm bill 2020 over time
Fig. 2: Geographical Distribution of Tweets

Figure 2 shows the geographical distribution of the participating tweets. This plot considers only those tweets which disclose th location of the tweets. It is evident from the figure that people from all over the world have shown concern with Farm bills. Among the 40k hashtags, #FarmerProtest has been the most influencing hashtag with 2,33,155 tweets, followed by #FarmLaws, #ModiWithFarmers, #किसान_एकता_जिंदाबाद, #किसान_आंदोलन, etc. Figure 3 shows the word cloud of 200 most popular 200 hashtags related to farm bill 2020. The hashtag #FarmersProtest dominates the other hashtags. It appears for the first time on 10 September 2020 at in the tweet हरिणाया में कृषि अध्यादेशों के विरोध में रैली निकाल रहे थे किसान, पुलिस ने लाठीचार्ज किया, कई किसान घायल #Haryana #FarmersProtest. As mentioned above, it is also the first tweet spotted by विश्लेषकी related to farm bills. Some of the handles which are most frequently mentioned in the tweets are @ndtv, @aajtak, @narendramodi, @BJP4India, @ANI, @PMOIndia, @RahulGandhi, @IndiaToday, @ABPNews, @sherryontopp, @nstoma (Figure 4). Figure 5 shows the top users who have contributed most number of tweets.

Fig. 5: Users with the highest number of tweets
Fig. 6 : Sentiment distribution of tweets related to farmers protest over time

Based on the sentiment analysis module integrated with विश्लेषकी, tweets bearing negative sentiment dominate the number of tweets with positive and neutral sentiments (refer Figure 6). About 48% of the tweets contribute to negative sentiments and only about 20% contribute to positive sentiment.
Fig 7. Discussions Timeline in context of Farmer Protests 2020

The Evolution: Figure 7 shows the evolution of different important issues linking to farm bills. It started with protest related to the bill with #FarmersProtest and calling for support using #SpeakUpForFarmers in the month of September. In the month of October, promotion of the bill with the hashtag like #KisanWithPMModi and its counter tweets with #KisanVirodhiNarendraModi are evident. The raise of MSP issue is seen in October. In November, criticism over media and government using #GodiMedia and #ShameonModiGovt and march to Delhi with #FarmersDilliChalo are visible. The supreme court intervention is visible from the hashtag #SupremeCourtStand4Farmers in December. Organization of tractor rally is also seen in January with #TractorRally. Many interesting patterns such as linking of the farm protest with Khalistan, Terrorism and Pakistan, raise of Rakesh Tikait, caimping of farmers at Singhu and Ghazipur border are visible in the month of January. Further, linking of protest to religion, organization of rail bandh, detaining of farmers and media personalities are seen in the month of February.
Fig. 8: Distribution of the tweets containing the hashtag #FarmerProtest over time.
Fig. 9: Distribution of the tweets containing the hashtag #FarmerProtest between 10th September and 25th September 2020.

Tracing of top tending hashtag - #FarmersProtest As shown in Figure 3, #FarmersProtest is the most trending hashtag among the 40k hashtags related with farm bills extracted by विश्लेषकी. There are 23,3134 tweets containing #FarmersProtest. As shown in Figure 8 and 9, the first tweet with the #FarmerProtest hashtag is spotted on 10th September 2020 in the tweet हरिणाया में कृषि अध्यादेशों के विरोध में रैली निकाल रहे थे किसान, पुलिस ने लाठीचार्ज किया, कई किसान घायल #Haryana #FarmersProtest https://t.co/61L5DrXs0g posted by GaonConnection(@GaonConnection). On this day, 27 number of tweets containing #FarmersProtest are noticed. Some of the other hashtags which are present in these 27 tweets are #lathicharge, #FarmerSuicide, #Farmer, #SameOnHaryanaGov, #Piplilathicharge etc. Interestingly, one of the tweet (@ndtv #Haryana #Farmers #FarmersProtest #DrugMafia #Kangana #KanganaRanuat #KanganaVsUddhav Indian Farmers Anti India Actor https://t.co/78gdzvrwOu) among these 27 tweets links the protest with drug, actor, politician etc. Figure 7 further zooms in the tweet distribution between September 10 to September 25 2020. As noticed in the figure, this is the period where initial protest kicks off. Though there are few tweets posted on 10th September, the surge in tweets starts from 18th September, then on 20th and then sudden spike on 25th September. It may be noted that Farm Bill 2020 is tabled on 17th September in Lok Sabha, 20th in Rajya Sabha, and President’s assent on 27th September.

As shown in Figure 1 and 8, though the presence of the tweets on farmer protest starts sometime in the second week of September, the major tending starts from 25th November which is the day of marching farmers from Haryana to Delhi. Some of the hashtags which are frequently co-occurred

with #FarmerProtest are #FarmLaws, #Farmers, #RakeshTikait, #ReleaseDetailedFarmers, #IStandWithFarmers, #ModiPlanningFarmerGenocide, #FarmersAboveReligiousHate etc

Most re-tweeted Tweets.
Among the tweets related to farm bills, the tweets why aren’t we talking about this?! #FarmersProtest https://t.co/obmIlXhK9S posted by Rihana(@rihana) and We stand in solidarity with the #FarmersProtest in India. https://t.co/tqvR0oHgo0 posted by Greta Thunberg (@GretaThunberg) get the highest number of re-tweets. The Rihana’s tweet is also the most quoted and replied tweet. Interestingly Akshay Kumar’s(@akshaykumar) tweet Farmers constitute an extremely important part of our country. And the efforts being undertaken to resolve their issues are evident. Let’s support an amicable resolution, rather than paying attention to anyone creating differences. 🙏🏻#IndiaTogether #IndiaAgainstPropaganda is the second most replied tweet. While looking at ten most retweeted tweets, four are in support of #FarmersProtest, two are in support of the bill, and four are reporting item of farmers’ protest from @NDTV. Though Rihana’s tweet attracted maximum number of tweets, more than 98% of the re-tweets are contributed in the first three days. Similar characteristics are observed for rest of the nine tweets.

The tweet #IndiaTogether #IndiaAgainstPropaganda https://t.co/TfdgXfrmNt https://t.co/gRmIaL5Guw from @MEAIndia on 3rd February 2021 is also one among the most retweeted tweets. Figure 10 shows network of its retweet and its fall-out quoted and reply tweets (the red central dot in the left corner indicates the above tweet from @MEAIndia). Though all the tweets in the figure is originated from the above tweet, it is interesting to see that the quoted tweet from the tweet is from Akshay Kumar’s(@akshaykumar (central node in the right side) becomes another central point of discussion creating another major fall out event. Tracing of such fall-out events are important for social media data analysts.
Fig 11. The network of top 50 co-occurring hashtags with that of #FarmersProtest
Fig 12. The network of top 50 co-occurring hashtags with that of #Khalistan.

Network Analysis – tracing the connection between #FarmersProtest and #Khalistan: Hashtags, mentions and handles are the active players in exploiting relational structure in tweets. Figure 11 shows the network structures of the top 50 co-occurring hashtags with that of #FarmersProtest and #Khalistan. It is also interesting to observe from the figure that the #modi_rojgar_do is one of the most frequently discussed hashtag with #FarmersProtest inviting attention of the unemployment issue as well. Further, #Khalistan is one of the hashtags frequently being used in the farmers protest 2020, which has come into spotlight at numerous stages of the protest such as the Red Fort incident of 26th January 2021. Interestingly, as shown in the figure, the hashtag #Khalistan has been frequently linked with #India, #Pakistan, and #Terrorism.

If the two networks are combined, we can see the nodes linking the two network. Figure 12 shows the joined network. The network component in green colour represents members from the network #Khalistan, whereas component in blue corresponds to the network of #FarmersProtest. It is to be observed from figure that the two networks are associated with each other via the hashtags with red colour i.e., #FarmerProtests, #DishaRavi and #FarmerProtest. Interestingly, the hashtag #DishaRavi links to toolkit that the government of claims as the cause of the red fort case on 26th Jannuary 2021.
Fig 12. The connection between #FarmersProtest and #Khalistan

Conclusion: विश्लेषकी (Vishleshakee) is a general purpose tool for analysis Twitter data. This article shows extraction of tweets related to Farm Bills 2020 from a generic collection of tweets received by विश्लेषकी and deeper analysis for the data from different perspective such as monitoring and tracing of tweets, hashtags and handles, network analysis, tracking of retweets and their fall-out events etc.
